newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan plans overseas lobby to attract investments.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan plans overseas lobby to attract investments.

text.p: Taiwan plans to launch overseas lobbying to attract multinational companies to invest on the island, Economics Minister Wang Chih-kang said on Wednesday.
"The (ministry's) industrial development and investment centre will go overseas to attract famous international companies to come to Taiwan," Wang said on state-funded radio.
"Our aim is to attract at least five to 10 international companies to Taiwan every year," Wang said.
Taiwan would improve the domestic investment environment and help businessmen to remove obstacles in investments, the radio quoted Wang as saying. He did not further elaborate.
Taiwan launched an Asia-Pacific Operation Centre project in 1995, hoping to turn the island into a regional business hub like Hong Kong or Singapore.
